statement:
**Theorem.** For non-negative numbers $x$ and $y$, the inequalities
$$\sqrt{xy} \;\leqq\; \frac{x\!+\!\sqrt{xy}\!+\!y}{3} \;\leqq\; \frac{x\!+\!y}{2}$$
are in , i.e. the Heronian mean is always at least equal to the
geometric mean and at most equal to the arithmetic mean. The equality
signs are true if and only if $x = y$.\
[*Proof.*]{}\
$1^\circ.$ $$\begin{aligned}
\sqrt{xy}\;\leqq\;\frac{x\!+\!\sqrt{xy}\!+\!y}{3}&\quad\Leftrightarrow\quad 3\sqrt{xy} \leqq x\!+\!\sqrt{xy}\!+\!y\\ 
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 2\sqrt{xy} \leqq x\!+\!y\\ 
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 4xy \leqq x^2\!+\!2xy\!+\!y^2\\
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 0 \leqq x^2\!-\!2xy\!+\!y^2\\
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 0 \leqq (x\!-\!y)^2\end{aligned}$$
$2^\circ.$ $$\begin{aligned}
\frac{x\!+\!\sqrt{xy}\!+\!y}{3} \leqq \frac{x\!+\!y}{2}\;\;& \quad\Leftrightarrow\quad 2x\!+\!2\sqrt{xy}\!+\!2y \leqq 3x\!+\!3y\\ 
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 2\sqrt{xy} \leqq x\!+\!y\\
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad  4xy \leqq x^2\!+\!2xy\!+\!y^2\\
& \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad 0 \leqq (x\!-\!y)^2\end{aligned}$$ All
inequalities of both chains are since $x$ and $y$ are non-negative. As
for the equalities, the chains are valid with the mere equality signs.
names: Heronian mean is between geometric and arithmetic mean
